aa

Class Predicate

  • java.lang.Object
    • aa.Node
      • aa.Predicate

  • public class Predicate
extends Node
    Class for a particular instance of a relation with a particular tuple of variables

    • Method Detail

      • computeRange

        public byte computeRange()
        Compute the variable range of this Predicate. Uses a byte representation of the range, see numVarsForThisRange()
        Returns:
        a byte representation of the variable range

      • proverName

        public java.lang.String proverName()
        Return a prover-readable String for this Predicate. Calls the method name()
        Overrides:
        proverName in class Node
        Returns:
        the String

      • varTuple

        public char[] varTuple()
        Get the variable tuple for this Predicate. In practice this is the same as the human-readable String, but this is an overloaded method, and we need both versions. Calls the method name()
        Returns:
        a char array of the variable tuple

      • setVarTuple

        public void setVarTuple(char[] tup)
        Set the variable tuple for this Predicate
        Parameters:
        tup - the tuple to set

      • variableRange

        public byte variableRange()
        Get the variable range
        Returns:
        a byte representation of the variables in the Predicate

      • parentRelation

        public Relation parentRelation()
        Get the parent relation of this Predicate. This allows access to the fact table for this predicate in truth-value methods.
        Returns:
        the parent relation

      • name

        public java.lang.String name()
        Output a String representation: the Relation name plus the variable tuple between brackets, eg: P(x,y).
        Returns:
        the String for the Predicate
